news.title: Macrotech Developers aims to cut debt by nearly 40% in 2023: MD
news.para: Mumbai-based Macrotech Developers, which is one of the leading real estate firms in the country, markets its properties under the Lodha brand.

news.title: Gurugram: Tashee Capital Gateway buyers protest over delayed possession
news.para: According to the protesters, the project was launched in 2011. The builder-buyer agreements were signed in 2013 with the promise of delivery of flats by December 2015.

news.title: Rajasthan government used JDA, RHB to raze illegal buildings, acquire land
news.para: The civic body had demolished 18 big buildings in 2019, 20 in 2020, 16 in 2021 and 22 in 2022. The year started off with fresh waves of demolitions.

news.title: Lack of checks at construction sites kicks up dust, makes Mumbai ill
news.para: A large number of Mumbaikars are now complaining about dust from construction sites polluting the air they breathe. In fact, a 2020 study by NEERI and IIT-B clearly showed road or construction dust as the source of over 70% of the particulate matter (PM) load in Mumbai’s air.

news.title: Kolkata civic body struggles to pull down unsafe buildings
news.para: ​According to a source in the KMC buildings department, though the demolition work was handed over to a private agency a month-and-a-half ago, the agency has so far been able to raze only portions.

news.title: Six lakh residents yet to pay property tax in Chennai
news.para: An enforcement drive would be conducted soon to collect property tax, officials said, adding that so far they had received a tax revenue of 1,240 crore in the financial year 2022-23.

news.title: Only 12 of 7,800 impact fee applications cleared so far in Ahmedabad
news.para: ​​According to sources, the civic body has asked 2,012 applicants to submit supporting documents which has still not been done.

news.title: Kajaria Ceramics' net profit dips 41% in Q3 FY23
news.para: Kajaria Ceramics' total consolidated income stood at Rs 1,098.61 crore in Q3 FY23, a growth of 2.13 per cent from Rs 1,075.65 crore it recorded in the similar quarter last year.

news.title: Green hurdle hits Delhi Metro hard, project delays may escalate cost by up to 15%
news.para: The officials said the three lines would have been completed at a cost of Rs 10,479.6 crore but would now cost not less than Rs 12,048.5 crore, causing an additional expenditure of about Rs 1,568.8 crore.

news.title: BMRCL planning Bengaluru metro to Challaghatta, BIEC
news.para: There are also proposals to extend the metro beyond BIEC. Additionally, Nelamangala has multiple connecting roads - Hassan, Tumakuru, Airport (via Madhure), and NICE roads. This is helping people to relocate there as they can travel to and beyond Bengaluru without getting stuck in traffic.

news.title: Property tax camps in Rajarhat, Gopalpur
news.para: It is planning to hold tax camps at highrises and the neighbourhoods in the Rajarhat-Gopalpur area. The authorities have already achieved over 50% of its target to collect about Rs 60 crore as property tax this fiscal.

news.title: Vadodara civic body proposes hike in property tax
news.para: In its budget for 2023-24, The Vadodara Municipal Corporation (VMC) on Friday proposed to increase the annual property tax from Rs 16 per sq m to Rs 20 per sq m.

news.title: Cabinet approves planning areas for 10 towns in Bihar
news.para: Arwal, Supaul, Sonepur, Sheikhpura, Banka, Gopalganj, Jehanabad, Madhepura, Nawada and Bhagalpur are the towns where the government plans to envisage planned urbanisation and development activities in the allied rural areas having urban potential.

news.title: Gurugram: 400 walk in to camp on day 1 to fix flaws in property tax data
news.para: The camp will be held at the community centre of DLF-1 on Saturday and at the old MCG office on Sunday. The objections and claims will be addressed on the spot through the no-objection certificate (NDC) portal.

news.title: Punjab government to build 5,000 flats for EWS sections in Mohali
news.para: Aman Arora announced that Punjab government has proposed to construct 25,000 EWS flats across the state. He added that GMADA would construct 5,000 flats for economically weaker sections (EWS) in the city under the first phase of the scheme.
